humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there is one positive lymph node out of 16 assessed lymph nodes in the left axillary sentinel node #1 (part A), intraop lymph node left axilla (part C), and left axillary content (part E). This corresponds to N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer in the lymph nodes. In this report, it is stated that one out of sixteen examined lymph nodes contains metastatic carcinoma with a largest metastasis size of 3 mm and minimal extracapsular extension. This information indicates that the patient has cancer in at least one lymph node, classifying them as N1. The substaging information, such as the number of positive lymph nodes or the size of the largest metastasis, is not necessary for determining the N stage and has been disregarded.
